# AvatarButton component and hover effect (2025-12-24 06:50Z)

_**User (2025-12-24 03:36Z)**_

@packages/hip-ui/src/components/avatar/index.tsx add a new export AvatarButton. It should take the same props as the avatar and pass them to Avatar but wraps it in a react-aria Button. Remove the default button styling and pass the button props to the Button. When hovered we should fade in a absoluetly position overlay is the back with a 0.5 opacity. it should match the border radius of the avatar

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_

---

      fontSize: fontSize["xl"],
    },
+   buttonWrapper: {
+     background: "none",
+     border: "none",
+     padding: 0,
+     margin: 0,
+     cursor: "pointer",
+     position: "relative",
+     display: "inline-block",
+   },
+   overlay: {
+     position: "absolute",
+     top: 0,
+     left: 0,
+     right: 0,
+     bottom: 0,
+     backgroundColor: uiColor.overlay,
+     opacity: 0,
+     transitionProperty: "opacity",
+     transitionDuration: animationDuration.default,
+     transitionTimingFunction: animationTimingFunction.easeOut,
+     pointerEvents: "none",
+   },
+   overlayHover: {
+     opacity: 0.5,
+   },
+   overlaySm: {
+     borderRadius: {
+       default: radius["sm"],
+       [mediaQueries.supportsSquircle]: radius["3xl"],
+     },
+   },
+   overlayMd: {
+     borderRadius: {
+       default: radius["md"],
+       [mediaQueries.supportsSquircle]: radius["3xl"],
+     },
+   },
+   overlayLg: {
+     borderRadius: {
+       default: radius["lg"],
+       [mediaQueries.supportsSquircle]: radius["3xl"],
+     },
+   },
+   overlayXl: {

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: /Users/andrew/Documents/hip-ui/packages/hip-ui/src/components/avatar/index.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 50, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -220,3 +220,53 @@
    );
  }
+
+ export interface AvatarButtonProps
+   extends Omit&lt;AvatarProps, "style"&gt;,
+     StyleXComponentProps&lt;AriaButtonProps&gt; {
+   /** The style for the avatar. */
+   avatarStyle?: AvatarProps["style"];
+ }
+
+ export function AvatarButton({
+   avatarStyle,
+   style,
+   size: sizeProp,
+   ...props
+ }: AvatarButtonProps) {
+   const size = sizeProp || use(SizeContext);
+   const { onPress, onPressStart, onPressEnd, onPressChange, ...avatarProps } =
+     props as AvatarProps &amp; AriaButtonProps;
+   const buttonProps = {
+     onPress,
+     onPressStart,
+     onPressEnd,
+     onPressChange,
+   };
+
+   return (
+     &lt;AriaButton
+       {...stylex.props(
+         styles.buttonWrapper,
+         size === "sm" &amp;&amp; styles.overlaySm,
+         size === "md" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayMd,
+         size === "lg" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayLg,
+         size === "xl" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayXl,
+         style,
+       )}
+       {...buttonProps}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;Avatar {...avatarProps} size={size} style={avatarStyle} /&gt;
+       &lt;div
+         {...stylex.props(
+           styles.overlay,
+           size === "sm" &amp;&amp; styles.overlaySm,
+           size === "md" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayMd,
+           size === "lg" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayLg,
+           size === "xl" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayXl,
+         )}
+         data-hover={true}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/AriaButton&gt;
+   );
+ }

```

</details>

</tool-use>

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: /Users/andrew/Documents/hip-ui/apps/docs/src/components/avatar/index.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 52, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -221,3 +221,55 @@
    );
  }
+
+ export interface AvatarButtonProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;AriaButtonProps&gt;,
+     Pick&lt;AvatarProps, "size" | "src" | "alt" | "fallback"&gt; {
+   /** The style for the avatar. */
+   avatarStyle?: AvatarProps["style"];
+ }
+
+ export function AvatarButton({
+   avatarStyle,
+   style,
+   size: sizeProp,
+   src,
+   alt,
+   fallback,
+   ...buttonProps
+ }: AvatarButtonProps) {
+   const size = sizeProp || use(SizeContext);
+   const avatarProps: AvatarProps = {
+     src,
+     alt,
+     fallback,
+     size,
+   };
+   const { hoverProps, isHovered } = useHover({});
+
+   return (
+     &lt;AriaButton
+       {...stylex.props(
+         styles.buttonWrapper,
+         size === "sm" &amp;&amp; styles.overlaySm,
+         size === "md" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayMd,
+         size === "lg" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayLg,
+         size === "xl" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayXl,
+         style,
+       )}
+       {...mergeProps(buttonProps, hoverProps)}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;Avatar {...avatarProps} size={size} style={avatarStyle} /&gt;
+       &lt;div
+         {...stylex.props(
+           styles.overlay,
+           isHovered &amp;&amp; styles.overlayHovered,
+           size === "sm" &amp;&amp; styles.overlaySm,
+           size === "md" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayMd,
+           size === "lg" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayLg,
+           size === "xl" &amp;&amp; styles.overlayXl,
+         )}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/AriaButton&gt;
+   );
+ }

```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

Added the AvatarButton example to the docs.

1. **Created the example file** (`apps/docs/src/examples/avatar/button.tsx`) showing AvatarButton with click handlers.

2. **Added AvatarButton to the docs avatar component** (`apps/docs/src/components/avatar/index.tsx`) with the necessary styles and hover behavior.

3. **Updated the documentation** (`apps/docs/src/docs/components/content/avatar.mdx`) to include a "Button" section with the example.

The example shows two AvatarButton instances (one with an image, one with a fallback) that display an alert when clicked. The hover overlay fades in with 0.5 opacity when hovering over the button.

The documentation now includes the AvatarButton example in the Avatar component page.

---

Added an example for `FileDropDefaultTrigger` to the docs.

1. **Added `FileDropDefaultTrigger` to the docs component** (`apps/docs/src/components/file-drop-zone/index.tsx`) — exported the component with the necessary imports and styles.

2. **Created an example file** (`apps/docs/src/examples/file-drop-zone/default-trigger.tsx`) — shows how to use `FileDropDefaultTrigger` inside a `FileDropZone` to make the entire drop zone clickable.

3. **Updated the documentation** (`apps/docs/src/docs/components/form/file-drop-zone.mdx`) — added a "Default Trigger" section with the example.

The example shows:

- Using `FileDropDefaultTrigger` inside a `FileDropZone`
- Setting `position: "relative"` on the drop zone so the absolutely positioned trigger works
- Adding a minimum height for better visibility
- The trigger covers the entire drop zone, making it fully clickable

The documentation now includes the `FileDropDefaultTrigger` example in the File Drop Zone component page.

---
